string.text: Stop right there, you monster! Take another step and you're dead…
Markus, it's me… What's the matter with you?

An old man led me out of the spatial anomaly. He called himself “Hermit.” He brought me to this place and told me I'd be safe here. He also told me something about you and Stronglav: he said that you were the one who created the creature after you were caught in a blowout in the Cordon. Since then, Stronglav has been with you the whole time. He was only able to manifest himself as a separate entity from you after you stepped into the space bubble.
That's hard to believe… but if it's true, how do we get rid of this thing?
I don't know. We need to warn the others. We need to be ready for Stronglav…
All right. Let's go warn the others.
Don't try anything, you filth! Hermit told me every single detail! Do you think I'm gonna believe you're the real Beast? I'm no fool…
It's me, Markus. I don't know what that old man told you, but it really is me.
Yeah? And how are you going to explain your attempt on my life? When I followed you into this space bubble, you attacked me. How do you explain that?
What? But it wasn't me. It was probably Stronglav playing one of his sick games. I've never tried to hurt you.
Maybe you're telling the truth, but I'm not about to lower my gun. It's for my own sake. What are you doing here?

I came here from the Outpost. Those damn Monolith fanatics caught Savage and hauled him into the laboratory. I tried to save him, but he died. Stronglav took over his mind. I blew up the lab entrance so that Stronglav would remain trapped inside, and I hope we never see that bastard again.

So you don't get it?… Beast, that creature—Stronglav—you won't be able to get rid of him like that. He most certainly followed you here… Hermit told me about your link to Stronglav. You see, wherever you go, he'll come after you…
What?! Markus, what link are you talking about?
Greetings, Beast. We meet again. Listen to me carefully. I don't have much time… Stronglav has grown in power. He's trying to control my mind, but I can still resist him at the moment…
What are you talking about? Stronglav couldn't have gone in here. I blew up the passage behind me.
You're just lucky, but your luck won't save you forever… Remember: as long as you're alive, Stronglav will continue to exist…
So the only way to destroy him is to kill myself?…
Yes. Unfortunately, that is the only way.\n \nHere… Take your old pistol. I found it in… Ah, what's the difference?…
Why didn't you bring us out of the anomaly that one time? You helped me, but what about the guys, Sledgehammer and Marcus?

I couldn't. You had to understand everything and go down this path… There was no other option…\n \nResisting him is getting more difficult… Promise me that when you meet Stronglav face to face, you will make the right choice… Farewell, Beast…
I promise! Farewell, old man…
No, Beast. You're making a mistake, and there's so much that you don't know… Stronglav is here, and he's following you wherever you go. Your connection to him is deeper than you might have thought.
What? What connection are you talking about, old man?
Do you remember the emission in the Cordon? The one that struck you? After waking up, didn't you feel like some part of you was gone?… Did you feel the emptiness inside?…
What are you saying? How do you know about the emission?

Don't be fooled. I've been following you for a long time. I know much about you… After the emission, part of your soul broke away from you, and that part took away your main qualities with it… and since then, this splinter has always accompanied you—always watched you—but… he was only able manifest himself as a separate entity after you appeared in the spatial bubble. The energy from the bubble has made him very strong, but has not given him a material body…
So… I created this beast?… How can I stop it?

Stop it?! I'm afraid you won't like this method… Stronglav's current goal is to attain a material body, but the only body in which he can take root is yours… If he succeeds, your mind will disappear forever; *you* will disappear forever…
He has already tried to conquer my conscience, but he failed.
What are you doing here, merc? Were you behind that explosion?

What I'm doing here?! I fought my way through the laboratory and tried to save a friend, which all went to hell… I had to block the way to your station in order to stop the creature that was chasing me.
Okay. I'll show you where he is, but if you try anything stupid, you'll be sorry for it.
Don't worry. I won't do anything.

What?… You came from the lab? Well, it's a good thing you blocked the path to it… The outpost you came from has been closed for a long time. The mutants would constantly barge into it and attack us. We very rarely go there, and if we do, it's only to grab the equipment from the warehouse. And what kind of creature were you trying to stop?
Hard to describe. I can only say that it's been chasing me from the moment I ended up in a spatial anomaly, even after leaving it.

It can't be. Another poor soul… A stalker came to us a few days ago and claimed that he got out of the anomaly as well. We didn't believe his nonsense, because his condition was bad, but now, we've got the same situation… So how do you feel, merc?
I'll live. Can you tell me the stalker's name?
Well, he said he goes by Markus. Why do you ask? Would you happen to know him?
I do. Where is he?
He's still here, helping the scientists in the lab.
Okay. Can you show me the way to the lab?
Well, we meet again, Beast! I like your new style… You'll certainly fit right in with those fanatics.
I'm not gonna bother with you anymore, Hatchet. This isn't the time or place for conflicts. Get the hell out of here, or else it's personal!

Well, you're certainly not very polite. Time changes everyone, Beast, but you remain the same. From the very first day when you were rescued by Fish, I knew you were a real prick. You betrayed everyone! You even betrayed the man who taught you everything. The man who thought of you as a brother. The man who was willing to give you one last mag of ammo. The man who was willing to cut someone's throat just for you alone!

Shut the fuck up, Hatchet! You can't judge me! You don't know who I am! I'm warning you one last time: put your weapons on the ground and get out of here while you still can. And take your boys with you.
Not only are you an absolute scoundrel, but you also have a lot of fucking nerve. We'll just have to blow your brains out of your stupid head!
As you wish, Hatchet. I gave you the chance to leave…
Aah, damn it… Beast, you shouldn't have followed me… This thing… It came out of nowhere; it was controlling the fanatics, and now it's trying to get into my head… It lured you here, Beast…
Savage, what the fuck are you talking about? That vile thing's still around there somewhere. Come on, man. We've got to get out of here.

No, no, no. It's too late… Listen, Beast: Petrovich showed me how to reconfigure your PDA. You won't be mixed up with the fanatics any longer. Aah… It's trying to get into my head again!… Stop it, Beast! Please… Don't worry about me. I can keep on going.
I'll stop it, Savage. I promise!
